radiographic_examinations.findings: Small bilateral pleural effusions and scattered subsegmental atelectasis in both lung bases; distended gallbladder with mild mural edema and multiple stones in the gallbladder neck; common bile duct mildly dilated (up to 8mm) with two or three tandem stones within the distal common bile duct; normal liver, pancreas, spleen, and adrenal glands; 5 mm cyst in the upper pole of the right kidney; postsurgical changes of a gastric bypass.
